intro: Calophanes angustus, commonly known as the narrowleaf calophane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Calophanes angustus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
